label: SquareUp API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.

tools.name: AcceptDisputeLoss
tools.description:
Accept the loss on a dispute and update its status to ACCEPTED.

This tool should be called when you need to accept the loss on a dispute for a transaction. It updates the dispute state to ACCEPTED and returns the disputed amount to the cardholder. Square debits the corresponding amount from the seller's account. Use this when a dispute resolution is finalized, and the seller agrees to the loss.

parameters.name: dispute_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the dispute to accept and resolve.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AccumulateLoyaltyPoints
tools.description:
Add points to a loyalty account for a purchase.

This tool adds loyalty points to a customer's account following a purchase. It can be used with or without the Orders API. If using the Orders API, provide the `order_id` for automatic point calculation based on the program and promotions. If not, manually compute and provide the `points` to add.

parameters.name: loyalty_account_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the target loyalty account to which points will be added.

parameters.name: purchase_location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the location where the purchase was made, necessary for loyalty point accumulation.

parameters.name: unique_request_id
parameters.description: A unique string identifier for the `AccumulateLoyaltyPoints` request. Must be unique for each request to ensure idempotency.

parameters.name: loyalty_program_id
parameters.description: The ID of the loyalty program to add points to. Required to identify the correct program.

parameters.name: order_id_for_accumulation
parameters.description: The ID of the order for which points are accumulated. Required if using the Orders API.

parameters.name: points_to_accumulate
parameters.description: Specify the number of points to add to the loyalty account from the purchase event if not using the Orders API.

tools.name: ActivateDomainForApplePay
tools.description:
Activates a domain for use with Apple Pay and Square.

Use this tool to activate a domain for Apple Pay on the Web with Square. It performs a validation to ensure the domain is Apple Pay enabled, allowing platforms to bulk activate Apple Pay for their merchants. Ensure a valid domain verification file is hosted as per the guidelines.

parameters.name: apple_pay_domain_name
parameters.description: Enter the domain name, as per RFC-1034, to register it with Apple Pay.

tools.name: AddCardToMerchant

This tool is used to store a new card on file for an existing merchant, facilitating future transactions. It provides confirmation once the card is successfully added.

tools.name: AddOrUpdateSquareOnlineSnippet
tools.description:
Add or update a snippet on a Square Online site.

This tool adds a new snippet to or updates an existing snippet on a Square Online site's `head` element. It excludes checkout pages and requires the site's ID. Use ListSites to find site IDs.

parameters.name: site_id_for_snippet
parameters.description: The ID of the site where you want to add or update the snippet. Obtained through ListSites function.

parameters.name: snippet_code_content
parameters.description: The code snippet to add or update, which can include valid HTML, JavaScript, or both. This will be appended to the head element of all site pages except checkout pages.

parameters.name: snippet_id
parameters.description: The Square-assigned ID for the snippet to add or update.

parameters.name: snippet_initial_creation_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp indicating when the snippet was initially added to the site, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: snippet_last_updated_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp for when the snippet was last updated on the site, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.name: snippet_site_id
parameters.description: The ID of the site that contains the snippet to be updated or added.

tools.name: AdjustLoyaltyPoints
tools.description:
Manually adjust loyalty points for a buyer's account.

Use this tool to manually add or subtract loyalty points from a buyer's account when automatic accumulation is not applied. Ideal for scenarios requiring manual point corrections.

parameters.name: loyalty_account_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the buyer's loyalty account to adjust.

parameters.name: points_adjustment_amount
parameters.description: The number of points to add or remove from the buyer's account.

parameters.name: unique_request_identifier
parameters.description: A unique string to identify this loyalty points adjustment request. Must be unique for each request to prevent duplicates.

parameters.name: adjustment_reason
parameters.description: The reason for adjusting the loyalty points, such as 'customer courtesy' or 'error correction'.

parameters.name: allow_negative_balance
parameters.description: Set to true to allow a negative balance after point subtraction. Defaults to false if not specified.

parameters.name: loyalty_program_id
parameters.description: The Square-assigned ID of the loyalty program to adjust points for.

tools.name: CalculateLoyaltyPoints
tools.description:
Calculate loyalty points a buyer can earn from a purchase.

Use this tool to determine the number of loyalty points to reward a buyer after a purchase. Provide either the `order_id` or `transaction_amount_money` to calculate points based on the order or purchase amount, respectively. Points calculation considers the base loyalty program, and possibly a loyalty promotion if applicable.

parameters.name: loyalty_program_id
parameters.description: The ID of the loyalty program, defining the rules for accruing points.

parameters.name: currency_code
parameters.description: Indicates the associated currency for an amount of money using ISO 4217 codes. For example, 'USD' for United States Dollar.

parameters.name: loyalty_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the target loyalty account. Optionally specify if using the Orders API. Determines promotion point eligibility based on trigger limits.

parameters.name: order_id
parameters.description: The Order ID used to calculate points. Provide this if using the Orders API. Otherwise, use transaction_amount_money.

parameters.name: transaction_amount_in_smallest_denomination
parameters.description: The amount of money for the transaction, given in the smallest denomination of the currency (e.g., cents for USD).

parameters.name: booking_revision_number

parameters.name: idempotency_key
parameters.description: Unique key to ensure the request is idempotent and prevents duplicate operations.

tools.name: CancelTransferOrder

Cancel a transfer order in progress for inventory locations.

Use this tool to cancel a transfer order that is in either STARTED or PARTIALLY_RECEIVED status. This is useful in situations where items are no longer needed at the destination, the source location requires the inventory, or if the order was created by mistake. Cancelling the order will update inventory levels and trigger a transfer_order.updated webhook event.

parameters.name: transfer_order_version
parameters.description: Provide the version number for optimistic concurrency when canceling the transfer order.

  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

tools.name: CreateWebhookSubscription
tools.description:
Creates a webhook subscription.

Use this tool to establish a webhook subscription for receiving event notifications from the service.

parameters.name: api_version
parameters.description: Specifies the API version for the webhook subscription. Optional; defaults to the application's current API version if not provided.

parameters.name: enable_subscription
parameters.description: Indicates whether the subscription is enabled (`true`) or not (`false`).

parameters.name: event_types
parameters.description: An array of event types for the subscription, each as a string.

parameters.name: subscription_created_at
parameters.description: The creation timestamp of the subscription in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

parameters.name: subscription_last_updated_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of when the subscription was last updated, in RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z').

parameters.name: subscription_name

parameters.name: subscription_signature_key

parameters.name: subscription_unique_id
parameters.description: A Square-generated unique ID for the webhook subscription.

parameters.name: unique_request_identifier
parameters.description: A unique string to ensure the idempotence of the CreateWebhookSubscription request, preventing duplicate entries.

parameters.name: webhook_notification_url
parameters.description: The URL where webhook notifications will be sent. Ensure it is accessible and accurately formatted.

tools.name: FetchInventoryChanges
tools.description:
Retrieve historical inventory changes and adjustments.

Use this tool to access historical physical counts and inventory adjustments based on specific filter criteria. The results are paginated and sorted by the `occurred_at` timestamp in ascending order, providing a comprehensive log of inventory changes.

parameters.name: filter_by_catalog_object_ids
parameters.description: Filter results by providing an array of CatalogObject IDs. Only applicable when set.

parameters.name: filter_by_location_ids
parameters.description: Return results filtered by specific `Location` IDs. This is optional and defaults to null.

parameters.name: filter_by_updated_before_timestamp
parameters.description: Return results with `created_at` or `calculated_at` before this RFC 3339 timestamp.

parameters.name: filter_inventory_change_types
parameters.description: A list of `InventoryChangeType` values to filter results, excluding `TRANSFER`. Default is `[PHYSICAL_COUNT, ADJUSTMENT]`.

parameters.name: filter_updated_after_timestamp
parameters.description: Return results with `calculated_at` after specified time in RFC 3339 format. Default is the UNIX epoch (`1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`).

parameters.name: inventory_states_filter
parameters.description: Filter to return `ADJUSTMENT` query results by `InventoryState`. Only applies if set. Accepts a list of states.

parameters.name: number_of_records_to_return
parameters.description: The number of inventory change records to return in the response.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination to retrieve the next set of inventory results. Use this from a previous call to continue fetching data.

parameters.name: location_id

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A string cursor from a previous call to retrieve the next set of dispute results. See [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/pagination).

tools.name: ListScheduledShifts
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of scheduled shifts with filtering options.

Fetch a paginated list of scheduled work shifts. You can apply filters and sort the results, which are by default ordered by start time in ascending order.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: ObtainOauthToken
tools.description:
Obtain OAuth access and refresh tokens.

This tool is used to obtain an OAuth access token and refresh token using either the authorization_code or refresh_token grant type. It's applicable for both code flow and PKCE flow scenarios, depending on the credentials and additional parameters provided.

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.description: The Square-issued ID of your application, available as the Application ID in the Developer Console. Required for code and PKCE flows.

parameters.name: oauth_grant_type
parameters.description: Specifies the method for obtaining an OAuth access token. Choose from 'authorization_code', 'refresh_token', or 'migration_token'.

parameters.name: application_client_secret
parameters.description: The application's secret key from the Developer Console, required for code flow. Distinct from a personal access token.

parameters.name: application_redirect_url
parameters.description: The registered redirect URL for your application. Required for code flow and PKCE flow if `grant_type` is `authorization_code`.

parameters.name: authorization_code
parameters.description: The authorization code for exchanging an OAuth access token, required for code flow and PKCE flow if `grant_type` is `authorization_code`.

parameters.name: expire_token_in_24_hours
parameters.description: Set to true to make the access token expire in 24 hours. Optional for any grant type.

parameters.name: legacy_migration_token
parameters.description: A valid legacy access token for generating a new OAuth access token, required if `grant_type` is `migration_token`.

parameters.name: pkce_code_verifier
parameters.description: The secret your application generated for the authorization request, required for PKCE flow when `grant_type` is `authorization_code`.

parameters.name: requested_scopes
parameters.description: List of permissions for the access token, like ["MERCHANT_PROFILE_READ", "PAYMENTS_READ"]. Optional for certain flows.

parameters.name: valid_refresh_token
parameters.description: A valid refresh token used to generate a new OAuth access token, returned in a previous ObtainToken response. Required for the code and PKCE flow if grant_type is refresh_token.

Custom attributes must have visibility settings of VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY or VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES unless defined by the seller.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: RetrievePaymentsList
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of payments from your account.

Use this tool to access a list of payments made through your account. It provides a consistent overview of payment transactions, with a maximum of 100 results per page. Note that changes to payments may take a few seconds to reflect.

parameters.name: card_last_four_digits
parameters.description: Filter payments by the last four digits of the payment card used.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End of the time range for retrieving payments, in RFC 3339 format. Defaults to the current time.

parameters.name: end_time_updated_for_payments
parameters.description: The end time for retrieving payments, in RFC 3339 format, based on `updated_at`.

parameters.name: is_offline_payment
parameters.description: Set to true to include offline payments, or false to exclude them.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of payment results to return per page (up to 100). Defaults to 100 if more is specified.

parameters.name: offline_end_time
parameters.description: The end time in RFC 3339 format for retrieving offline payments, based on the `offline_payment_details.client_created_at` field. Default is the current time.

parameters.name: offline_payment_start_time
parameters.description: Start of the time range for retrieving offline payments in RFC 3339 format. Uses 'offline_payment_details.client_created_at'.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A pagination cursor for fetching the next set of payment results from the ListPayments endpoint.

parameters.name: payment_card_brand
parameters.description: The brand of the payment card to filter payments (e.g., VISA, MasterCard).

parameters.name: results_sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the order of the results: `ASC` for oldest to newest, `DESC` for newest to oldest (default).

parameters.name: sort_by_field
parameters.description: Choose the field to sort results by. Options: `CREATED_AT`, `OFFLINE_CREATED_AT`, `UPDATED_AT`. Default is `CREATED_AT`.

parameters.name: specific_location_id
parameters.description: Limit results to the specified location ID. Defaults to the main location associated with the seller.

parameters.name: start_time_range
parameters.description: Start time to retrieve payments, in RFC 3339 format. Defaults to one year ago if not specified.

parameters.name: total_payment_amount
parameters.description: The exact amount in the total_money field for a payment. Use an integer to specify the amount in cents.

parameters.name: updated_at_start_time
parameters.description: Start of the time range for retrieving payments based on the `updated_at` field, in RFC 3339 format.

parameters.description: The unique ID of the subscription to update. This is required to identify the webhook subscription that needs to be modified.

parameters.name: api_version_of_subscription
parameters.description: Specify the API version for the subscription. Optional for creation and defaults to the application's API version if not provided.

parameters.description: An array of event types associated with this subscription that trigger the webhook.

parameters.name: signature_key
parameters.description: The Square-generated signature key for validating the webhook origin.

parameters.description: The timestamp indicating when the subscription was created, formatted in RFC 3339.

parameters.description: Set to `true` to enable the subscription or `false` to disable it.

parameters.description: The new name for the webhook subscription to update.

parameters.description: A Square-generated unique ID for the webhook subscription to be updated. This is required to identify which subscription to modify.

parameters.name: updated_at_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of the last update for the subscription, in RFC 3339 format (e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z").

parameters.name: webhook_notification_url
parameters.description: The URL to which webhooks are sent. Must be a valid URL that can receive POST requests.

summary: SquareupApi is a toolkit designed for integrating with the Squareup API, empowering developers to facilitate seamless interactions with various Square services. This toolkit enables various operations, including managing customer data, handling invoices, and managing loyalty points.  **Capabilities:**  - Access detailed information about customers, orders, and transactions.  - Perform CRUD operations on bookings, inventory, and payments. - Manage loyalty programs, including points and rewards.  **OAuth:** The toolkit utilizes OAuth2 authentication via Squareup, with scopes allowing comprehensive access to appointments, customers, payments, and more.  **Secrets:** None required.
